alert.note: Alert for Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 1:40PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Galveston. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 138 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms resulting in stalled vehicles. High water has been observed along 14th, 43rd, 45th, and 39th Streets and Harborside Drive. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galveston Island West End, Galveston Causeway, Galveston Pier 21, Jamaica Beach, Galveston State Park, Scholes Field, Schlitterbahn, Moody Gardens, Offatts Bayou, Galveston Island East End, Galveston Pleasure Pier, The Strand, Pelican Island and San Luis Pass. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
